53853932.title: Data Analyst
53853932.teaser: Our highly talented people genuinely care about each other and it is this supportive culture that makes ASG a great place to work.
roleRequirements: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
What's your expected annual base salary?
How much notice are you required to give your current employer?
Do you hold Australian Security Clearance?
How many years' experience do you have as a data analyst?
53853932.jobAdDetails:
As the genuine alternative to global digital transformation players, working with ASG offers variety, transparency, and the opportunity to play a role in supporting the success of some of Australia’s largest brands and government agencies.
  
We are more than an IT company. We’re a team of innovators, strategic thinkers, and problem solvers, united by our values of Accountability, Initiative and Grit.
  
WHAT MAKES US ASG?
  
We are a community united by our dedication to living our values of Accountability, Initiative and Grit.
  
Our highly talented people genuinely care about each other and it is this supportive culture that makes ASG a great place to work. Through the breadth of our services, you will gain exposure to a diverse range of clients, industries and technologies. We offer you the flexibility to choose how you get the job done around the things you love. You will have the trust, support and autonomy to do your job and do it well. We value on-the-job learning and provide opportunities for professional development to help our ambitious, high achieving people pursue their goals. At ASG, your success is inevitable.
  
THE OPPORTUNITY
  
As a Consultant you will be someone who can join any environment and establish yourself as a subject matter expert as well as a trusted advisor. You will gain experience working in challenging environments with intelligent, like minded professionals. You will grow with the business as we define new service offerings and better ways to serve our customer’s needs.
  
DESIRED EXPERIENCE
  • Data Collection & Integration, Profiling & Cleansing, Analysis & Reporting, and Insight & Forecasting experience is required
  • Microsoft data-stack technology (SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Azure Synapse Analytics, Data Factory) experience is required
  • Power BI or Tableau experience is required
  • Experience with tooling also from other database vendors is preferred
  • Data warehousing and Business Intelligence experience is preferred
  • Advanced Analytics and Process Automation (Predictive Analytics, Machine Learning, Cognitive Services, RPA) experience is preferred
  • Python, R, and Azure ML Studio skills are preferred
  • Experience with data governance, data quality management, metadata management, and master data management is preferred
  • Experience with data integration platforms and IoT is preferred
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
  
In exchange for your exceptional technical skills, customer focused performance & out of the box thinking you’ll be rewarded with a career changing experience only consulting can provide.
  • Unwavering focus on professional development
  • Diverse & challenging project work
  • Paid certifications
  • Flexibility to juggle what’s important to you with work
  • Committed health & wellbeing plan
  • Competitive salary packages
  • Corporate partnerships
DIVERSITY & INCLUSION
  
We celebrate the diversity of people, and we pride ourselves on ensuring everyone belongs. As an equal opportunity employer, we want to create opportunities for everyone and will consider all applications without bias.
  
We value our collaborative culture and work together to support a variety of community organisations and social issues.

53923652.title: Junior Data Analyst
53923652.teaser: You will be responsible for delivering analytical solutions and insights though data science techniques to support the strategic needs of Datacom.
roleRequirements: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
53923652.jobAdDetails:
Our Purpose
The Datacom Connect business provides front line contact centre services and technical solutions to our clients. Our vision is to design and deliver meaningful, efficient and effective customer interactions, putting us at the cutting edge of service delivery and CX.
  
Our Team
Our team is made up of a tightly aligned, culturally diverse, autonomous professionals who pride themselves in being good team players. We work from different cities with a mix of office and remote working, give of our best time and talents to our team and customers. Rest assured that in all you do, our team of the skilled professionals are on hand to support.
  
Role Purpose
This role will be a steppingstone into the team and will be responsible for delivering analytical solutions and insights though data science techniques to support the strategic needs of Datacom Connect business.
The overall purpose will be to design, develop analytics solutions, reporting and data visualisation that add business value and insights. Debug, monitor, and troubleshoot reporting, analytics solutions, reporting & data visualisation. Research and utilise best practice to optimise and improve analytics solutions, reporting & data visualisation.
  
What you’ll do
  • Define and clarify requirements, propose and develop appropriate solutions, and provide feedback to the reporting team and internal customers
  • Deliver insightful data visualisations to stakeholders and clients through the extensive use of data visualisation techniques, analytics dashboard design and analytics delivery best practices to add business value
  • Serves as the subject matter expert for data analytics, business intelligence & data visualisation related tools
  • Contribute to the design, development and implementation of data models leveraging leading edge data mining and machine learning tools and methodologies to drive improved business decisions and insights
  • Prepare, deliver and update reports to support contractual obligations and the performance of our business to both internal and external customers in a timely manner
  • Conduct regular maintenance and improvements to analytics solutions, reporting & data visualisation
  • Working closely with key Stakeholders to clearly define and understand reporting and data requirements as well as presenting findings, insights and recommendations as the subject matter expert
  • Adapt quickly and effectively to changes in departmental or strategic priorities by responding to requests for additional adhoc reporting
  • Create and maintain required documentation
  
  
What you’ll bring
  • Advanced User of Microsoft office Suite
  • Demonstrate strong verbal and numerical skills (complex calculations, data analysis and reconciliation, numerical and verbal logical reasoning)
  • Extensive knowledge of databases, data integration, data analysis, aggregation and modelling using SQL
  • Machine learning
  • Intermediate programming skills in Python/R/SQL
  • Ability to develop strong relationships with key contacts
  • Change Management
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Time management & ability to work under pressure
  • Strong communication skills
  • Tertiary degree in qualitative disciplines such as mathematics, statistics, data science OR minimum 1 years’ experience in a data scientist or similar role
Australian Citizenship will be required for this role due to clearance level requirements.

About Datacom
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
We have over 6,500 people across our global offices and generate an annual revenue of over AU $1.1 billion annually. This makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We are committed to hiring, developing and promoting diverse talent.
Datacom has extensive expertise in the operation of contact centres, data centres, engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations.
Founded in 1965, we have a successful trading history of consistent growth, profitability and a track record of delivering innovative, cost effective technology solutions. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

The Benefits
Datacom offers a complete employee life cycle: from flexible working arrangements, inspiring leadership programs, development opportunities through to corporate wellness programs and a passion for the importance of work life balance.

Our future looks bright. And so can yours. If you're ready to make a move, we're ready to talk.

For further information please contact Cameron Peat - cameron.peat@datacom.com.au

54008191.title: Business Analyst - Data
54008191.teaser: Fantastic opportunity to develop a comprehensive understanding of business process and information needs to support the Member transformation
54008191.jobAdDetails:
• New expansive Tier 1 CRM Program
  • Bring your Business Analyst skills with awesome Data experience to RAA and join a high performing team in implementing our new CRM product as part of our Transformation Program!
  • Full Time, 2 Year Contract with Great Flexible Working Conditions with the high likelihood of extension

Your New Opportunity:

At RAA, we're all about enriching the lives of South Australians through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services.

That's why we're introducing world class systems and technologies to better empower our people to deliver great experiences to our 775,000 members.

We know innovation is the pathway to our future, so we're on the hunt for like-minded, forward-thinking specialists to help us bring these new technologies to life. If you share our passion for people and making lives better through technology - this could be the job for you.

Our growing and diverse organisation is backed by a global network of other future-focused motoring organisations, so there's never been a better time to consider RAA for your next big career move.

As such, we have a new position available for a high performing Business Analyst with specific experience working with Data to become an integral member of our core program team. This is a fantastic opportunity to develop a comprehensive understanding of business process and information needs to support the Member Management transformation program.

Responsibilities:

As a key member of our new Member Management Program team, you will have the opportunity to:

  • Assist in the definition and implementation of mastering customer data across RAA's core platforms
  • Define data migration, data warehousing and reporting requirements, testing plans and act as a conduit to business stakeholders to support the successful migration of critical organisational data and implementation of a new CRM platform
  • Conduct gap analysis and impact assessments for current vs future state and define business requirements for new member related reporting and analytics
  • Workshop data migration impacts with key stakeholders
  • Work to ensure data management solutions minimise future support effort as well as meeting immediate requirements

What sets you apart from the rest:

At RAA we hire on cultural fit first and technical fit second! However, to be successful in the role you will need to have:

  • Qualifications in Computing Science or related discipline desirable
  • Significant experience as a BA working with data, ideally on enterprise programs of work
  • Experience in CRM implementation highly desirable
  • Strong working knowledge of business process and information modelling
  • Outstanding stakeholder management skills with the ability to present ideas in language targeted at the relevant audience
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills with a high level of attention to detail

Your high-level communication, analytical and attention to detail skills, together with your excellent ability to organise workloads effectively to achieve agreed outcomes will see you succeed in this role, as will your ability to work under broad direction. Additionally, your energetic, self-motivated and innovative nature together with your high degree of integrity will add further to your success.

What sets us apart from the rest:

  • Excellent Flexible Work Arrangements, including Working from Home Options in conjunction with RAA's new Working Flex Program (flexible leave, flexible site and flexible time of work)
  • Inhouse Wellbeing and Resilience training program
  • Wellness days in addition to usual personal entitlements
  • Onsite Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • Free RAA Premium Road Service
  • Generous discounts on all RAA Products and Services
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • On-site Cafe with Barista

Simply hit "Apply for this job" and follow the prompts by sending us your Cover Letter and Resume (in PDF).

For more information, please contact Milja Perac - Talent Acquisition Consultant: MPerac2@raa.com.au

Applications close: 9am Tuesday 5th October 2021


We're committed to building a workplace that's diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone and helps us to give our members better service.

54008291.title: Data Analyst
54008291.teaser: Excellent opportunity to move your career to a highly regarded research organisation. Leverage your passion and apply your skills to make an impact.
roleRequirements: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
How many years' experience do you have as a data analyst?
54008291.jobAdDetails:
We are looking to fill a fixed-term Data Analyst position within our Data Services and Reporting Branch located in Adelaide.

About NCVER

The National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER) helps promote better understanding and discussion within the vocational education and training sector (VET), and assists policy makers, practitioners, industry, training providers, and students to make informed decisions.

We are the national professional body responsible for collecting, managing, analysing and communicating VET research and statistics.  More detail of our activities can be found on our Portal at www.ncver.edu.au

Position Details

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is keen to be involved in all aspects of the production process for our regular statistical releases, covering training activity, completion rates, student outcomes, and funding statistics. The role spans compilation, analysis and production of statistical outputs.

You will:

  • Apply analytical thinking to ensure our outputs are fit for purpose and provide meaningful representation of our data to our customers.
  • Apply your subject matter knowledge to solve problems and provide new insights to data.
  • Work on the development of new statistics or the re-development of existing statistics, to ensure our statistics remain relevant.
  • Engage with customers to service requests for tailored data.

About you

To be successful you will need to bring the following skills and experience:

  • Have at least 2 years of applicable work experience
  • Applied skills in analysing and interpreting large datasets (SAS or SQL preferred, other languages considered)
  • An analytical curiosity that drives you to ask questions and solve problems
  • Experience preparing reports and telling stories with data, ideally using a data visualisation platform (e.g. Qlik, PowerBI, Tableau)
  • A degree in a numerate discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Studies or relevant work experience
  • Experience in querying a star-schema dimensional model highly desirable
  • Experience analysing survey data highly desirable

Appointment Details

This is a fixed-term position for an initial period of 12 months (based in Adelaide).

  • Full-time or part-time working hours are negotiable.
  • Full-time equivalent salary will be in the range of $68,000 - $83,000 (plus 12% superannuation) commensurate with skills and experience.

To apply

If this sounds like you, please forward an application letter (maximum two pages in length) outlining your suitability for the position (in line with the skills and experience requirements listed above), plus your resume and contact details of two referees via email to statsrecruitment@ncver.edu.au.


Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday 6 October 2021

54040087.title: Graduate Technical Business Analyst
54040087.teaser: We are open to this role being based anywhere within Australia and remote work from home options are available.
roleRequirements: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
What's your expected annual base salary?
How much notice are you required to give your current employer?
54040087.jobAdDetails:
About Resolve Software

Here at Resolve Software, we have helped over 150 businesses around the world. We work with our customers to understand their requirements and implement a solution to manage complaints, requests, investigations, misconduct and general case management.

We are open to this role being based anywhere within Australia and the role 100% remote work from home. 

 

About the role

As a Graduate Technical Business Analyst at RSG, you will get the dynamic opportunity to work with a number of large clients to design and build Case Management solutions using Resolve Enterprise platform. You will play a key role in ensuring the success of the projects by managing and leading technical solutions design and configuration of client business solutions.

The Graduate Technical Business Analyst will work closely with the Business Solutions Consultant and Squad Lead Consultant in designing, building and managing the successful delivery of Resolve’s Business Solutions to each customers’ specific business requirements.

You will be able to deliver consistently on the following:

  • Contribute with the technical design and implementation of overall solution configuration (Data Model, UI, Workflow, Business Rules, Reporting and Security) for customer projects using Resolve Platform
  • Participate with the deployment of customer solutions
  • Contribute with the technical design and Implementation of interfaces and integration requirements
  • Participate with the technical design and Implementation of Data Migration requirements
  • Resolving support issues passed on by the Support Team for deployed solutions
  • Proactively identifying technical issues and blockers with PM, BSC and Squad Lead
  • You'll be exposed to peer quality reviews and making sure the configured solutions is following best practices
  • Multitasking and handling multiple customers and streams of work
  • Demonstration of technical solutions to the BSC, Squad Lead and customers as required
  • Contribution to process improvement in Professional Services
  • Technical documentation of the solution

 

Experience and Skills

Apart from being extremely passionate about ensuring the success of the professional services team, you will have the following to succeed in the role:

  • Prior software solution consulting experience in the areas of CRM / Workflow / BPM / Case Management will be highly regarded
  • Bachelor's degree in IT or related discipline
  • Prior experience in consulting/technical solution development or Business Analysis is desirable
  • Prior coding experience (in any programming language) is desirable
  • Strong skills in developing complex SQL queries
  • Prior Data Migration and Reporting experience is desirable
  • Good understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XML and HTTP
  • Up to date understanding of current technical trends
  • Proficient with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Visio, and Excel
  • Experience and Understanding of both the Agile SCRUM framework and Waterfall methodology
  • Effective communication skills that enable your messages to be conveyed in a clear and concise manner ensuring that the message comes across with the desired effect

 

 

Our culture and perks

What really sets us apart in the tech landscape is our passion and drive as family-like team. At Resolve Software we offer a range of benefits including:

  • Employee Share Purchase Plan from our parent company Constellation Software Inc.
  • Flexible leave offerings, including opportunities to purchase additional leave (up to 10 additional annual leave days)
  • EAP Support, offering mental/physical wellbeing counselling

 

How to apply

If this sounds like you, and you would like to work for an innovative company where you can make a difference, then we want to hear from you. To apply for this position, please send your CV coupled with a cover letter outlining your interest and suitability to the role via the Apply now link. 

 

For further information on us and our products, visit www.resolvesoftwaregroup.com Resolve Software is an entity of Jonas Software www.jonassoftware.com, the leading provider of enterprise management software for more than 40,000 customers across 15 countries. Jonas Software is a 100% owned subsidiary of Constellation.

54070317.title: Database Developer/Data Analyst
54070317.teaser: Looking for a flexible, hands-on person that is motivated and willing to do what it takes to deliver the very best outcomes to our partners
roleRequirements: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
How many years' experience do you have as a Database Developer?
What's your expected annual base salary?
Are you willing to relocate for this role?
54070317.jobAdDetails:
Position Title

Database Developer/Data Analyst

Extential Solutions

About Us

At Extential Solutions we believe in a better way of doing business, to Make business about people again

Our mission is:

“To be a new breed of people focused business, providing our partners outstanding outcomes - not just solutions”

What We Offer 

Extential Solutions are a new generation capability partner who pride ourselves on forging an unbeatable company culture, building relationships of the highest calibre, and delivering the very best services and products.

What We Offer Our Key Partners

  • Mutual success through a true outcome focus
  • Strategies & resources to unlock then realise their potential, and importantly
  • The peace of mind that only comes with the highest calibre of relationship and level of trust

Position Description

Overview

The Database Developer/Data Analyst position is an important role at Extential Solutions, reporting to the Technical Services Manager. The main focus of this role is the coordination and implementation of the technology behind a significant clinical research project across Australia. At high level this will include:

  • Liaison with key stakeholders around the country
  • Translation of business requirements into technical solutions
  • Maintaining and supporting a large cloud-based research/data platform
  • Data collection, integration, processing (translation, cleaning, mapping)
  • Database development/management 
  • Data quality verification and analysis
  • Text/language processing 

Given the clinical nature of the project, any form of clinical/health background is a huge positive, however the role is primarily technical and hence this is not a mandatory requirement and can be learnt on the job. The clinical research project will not entail the entirety of the role and depending on the skillset of the successful candidate there will be opportunities for them to contribute to a number of other areas of the business including software development, customer facing roles and internal processes.

We are looking for a flexible, hands-on person that is motivated and willing to do what it takes to deliver the very best outcomes to our partners at all times. The successful candidate will grow with the business and adapt to the changing needs of the Technical Services Department and Extential Solutions. The dynamic and evolving nature of the role provides a great platform and opportunity for personal growth and further development. The successful candidate will be involved in shaping not only their future in the role, but also driving both the cultural and commercial growth of the department and the wider business.

Qualifications and work experience

Bachelor of Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent is preferred, but not mandatory. At Extential Solutions, we value both education and proven commercial experience.

Experience, training, or qualifications in the area of customer management, AI or data analytics/big data are desirable.

Technology Skillset

Extential Solutions pride ourselves on staying at the forefront of technology and are constantly re-evaluating, reviewing, and adopting new technologies as they emerge. The technology skillset relevant to this role is:

mandatory

  • Microsoft SQL
  • Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Microsoft Azure

Highly Desirable

  • Python
  • Tensorflow
  • C# .Net 
  • Blazor
  • DevExpress/ Syncfusion
  • RESTful API
  • EF / Dapper
  • Docker / Containers
  • Microservice development and integration

Knowledge, and experience

The following list of knowledge, skills and experience are relevant to the role:

Technical

  • Extensive experience with hands on ETL development 
  • Working with SQL Server and analysing structured and unstructured data
  • A solid understanding and experience with SSIS pipeline creation/maintenance
  • Experience in detailed data analysis, quality assurance, data cleansing and data migration of very large datasets. 
  • MS SQL Server Platform: database engine, T-SQL and Complex Stored Procedures, complex Data migrations
  • Hands-on experience of SQL performance analysis and tuning, query optimisation
  • Azure infrastructure design and maintenance experience
  • Experience in ML, deep learning, Tensorflow, Python, NLP (desirable)
  • Strong background in C# and .NET (desirable)
  • Blazor and/or modern front-end UI frameworks would be advantageous (desirable)
  • Back-end technologies like: Entity Framework, modern monolithic and microservice-based architectural patterns. (desirable)
  • Experience in various database environments/technologies (desirable)
  • Full stack end-to-end development/delivery of products, software, and solutions in commercial environment (desirable)

General

  • Ability to translate business needs into technical specifications and solutions
  • Experience in working with stakeholders to design/enhance solutions to meet business needs.
  • A real passion for software and technology, staying up to date with all the latest trends and emerging innovations
  • The ability to balance technology and innovation with the practicalities and needs of a commercial business
  • Working in Agile teams and usage of tooling such as DevOps/Git. 
  • Ability to work in a team and contribute to the positive team culture 
  • Experience and proven delivery of outcomes within services/project and product environments
  • Business improvement strategies and frameworks within technical environments
  • Experience in Release/Product management (desirable)
  • Experience in Health IT/informatics (desirable)
  • Clinical background/experience (desirable) 
  • Experience in clinical research/data analysis (desirable)

Personal Attributes

At Extential Solutions, we value the following attributes in our people:

Experience - What you bring is valuable, we respect that. How can you adapt it for our environment?

Potential/Capability - We give our people room to grow and want people with the capability to do so.

Leadership - We believe true leadership should be effective at all levels of the organisation and both promote and protect the values of the business.

Trust and Respect - We need people that are willing to put everything on the table without holding back, while having the upmost respect for each other and our ideas and opinions. 

Motivation - We want people that are fully engaged, driven to grow, driven to achieve, and striving to hit our company goals.

Initiative - We believe in full delegation not micromanagement and want people that can thrive in this environment.

Loyalty - We cultivate a strong sense of business loyalty within our people and a strong sense of family, we need this from everyone.

Commitment - We need people that are willing to put in the hard yards required to deliver the very best service to our partners.

Personal Accountability - We can’t enforce this, we need people that will always do what they say, no matter the obstacles they may encounter.

Awareness -  Understand your surroundings and when they change, be prepared act, and constantly re-evaluate and course correct where required.

People Person - We are people people, we believe in building and maintaining the best relationships with each other and with our partners.

Our Values

Extential Solutions require that all employees live and breathe its values every day. They determine and drive every action we take as a business and as individuals, from the strategic to the operational. 

Relationship Focussed

People are at the heart of everything we do – We don’t make relationships to do business, we do business with people we have relationships with.

Quality and Care

Your problem is our problem - we genuinely care about what we do and who we do it for. We hold ourselves accountable to the highest standards, giving you complete piece of mind.

Outcome Focussed

Your goals and success drive us – We will always go the extra mile to get you the best outcome, not just the one you signed up for.  We only win if you win.

Loyalty and Integrity

If we say we’ll do it, we’ll do it -  We are fiercely loyal, not just internally but to our partners, and delivering on our promises is an integral part of who we are.

Family

We are a family – Supporting each other, having fun and succeeding together is what bonds us. We don’t believe in work-life balance, we believe in work-life integration.

Trust and Respect

We simply cannot do business without them - respect for one another’s ideas and trust that we all share the same goals leads to the very best of outcomes.

Additional information

  • Staff are expected to perform reasonable additional hours as required to meet business deadlines
  • Travel may be required
  • After hours support may be required

54092722.title: Business Analyst
54092722.teaser: Exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the South Australian Tertiary Admissions Centre (SATAC).
54092722.jobAdDetails:
(HEO7) $89,399 to $99,987 per annum plus an employer contribution of up to 17% superannuation may apply 

Full-time, fixed term contract available for two years.

Exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst within the South Australian Tertiary Admissions Centre (SATAC). 

The Business Analyst role, under limited direction, collaboratively contributes to processes and frameworks to assist SATAC to deliver projects and system related change efficiently. The role also works with stakeholders and SATAC’s management team as a trusted advisor and negotiates the effective use of SATAC’s resources in relation to features and functions of SATAC’s systems. This role would suit an experienced individual who is able to use their communications and analytical skills as part of a team to improve business systems and customer processes.

The Business Analyst works within a team of Business Analysts in the Change Delivery Hub but has a dotted line reporting to the Manager Direct Application Services and/or Manager, Shared Application Services through a matrix reporting relationship. The Business Analyst supports the design, configuration and implementation of features as required by SATAC’s departments, and adheres to quality assurance processes within business systems and projects. The role also supports Architecture and Development to deliver on its agreed roadmaps through consultation with stakeholders. 

To be successful you will need:  

  • Demonstrated experience in BABOK based business analysis, including problem diagnosis and resolution, and formulating procedural and programming specifications.
  • Demonstrated experience in project work, including planning, needs analysis, quality control and delivering measurable outcomes. Ability to be involved in several projects at the one time.
  • Excellent communication skills in addressing both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Proven experience in querying and analysing data held in a relational database and business intelligence tools, specifically Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS).
  • Demonstrated ability both to work as part of a team and to exercise initiative and to undertake a leadership role when required. 

Enjoy an outstanding career environment 

The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaboration - offers you vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career. 

It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration. 

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff. 

We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life. Flexible working arrangements are on offer for all roles at the University. 

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities. 

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs 

Your division's broader role 

The South Australian Tertiary Admissions Centre (SATAC) Limited provides reliable, efficient and innovative tertiary admissions services to its member institutions and on a fee for service basis to other tertiary education institutions in South Australia and the Northern Territory.  

SATAC manages centralised application and admissions processes on behalf of its members and participating fee for service institutions, as well as administering admissions aptitude tests, providing publication and research services, and acting as a one-stop shop for queries regarding application processes and outcomes. 

Learn more at: www.satac.edu.au 

If you have the talent, we'll give you the opportunity. Together, let's make history.

Click on the link below to view the position description and to apply for this opportunity: 

https://careers.adelaide.edu.au/cw/en/job/506183/business-analyst

Please ensure you submit a cover letter, resume, and upload a document that includes your responses to all of the selection criteria for the position as contained in the position description or selection criteria document. 

Applications close 11:55pm, 19 October 2021. 

For further information 

For a confidential discussion regarding this position, contact: 

Michelle Nash 
Manager, Change Delivery Hub 
P: +61 8 82244000 
E: michelle.nash@satac.edu.au  

The University of Adelaide is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who meet the requirements of this position are strongly encouraged to apply.

(HEO7) $89,399 to $99,987 per annum plus an employer contribution of up to 17% superannuation may apply 

Full-time, fixed term contract available for two years.

Exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst within the South Australian Tertiary Admissions Centre (SATAC). 

The Business Analyst role, under limited direction, collaboratively contributes to processes and frameworks to assist SATAC to deliver projects and system related change efficiently. The role also works with stakeholders and SATAC’s management team as a trusted advisor and negotiates the effective use of SATAC’s resources in relation to features and functions of SATAC’s systems. This role would suit an experienced individual who is able to use their communications and analytical skills as part of a team to improve business systems and customer processes.

The Business Analyst works within a team of Business Analysts in the Change Delivery Hub but has a dotted line reporting to the Manager Direct Application Services and/or Manager, Shared Application Services through a matrix reporting relationship. The Business Analyst supports the design, configuration and implementation of features as required by SATAC’s departments, and adheres to quality assurance processes within business systems and projects. The role also supports Architecture and Development to deliver on its agreed roadmaps through consultation with stakeholders. 

To be successful you will need:  

  • Demonstrated experience in BABOK based business analysis, including problem diagnosis and resolution, and formulating procedural and programming specifications.
  • Demonstrated experience in project work, including planning, needs analysis, quality control and delivering measurable outcomes. Ability to be involved in several projects at the one time.
  • Excellent communication skills in addressing both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Proven experience in querying and analysing data held in a relational database and business intelligence tools, specifically Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS).
  • Demonstrated ability both to work as part of a team and to exercise initiative and to undertake a leadership role when required. 

Enjoy an outstanding career environment 

The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaboration - offers you vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career. 

It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration. 

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff. 

We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life. Flexible working arrangements are on offer for all roles at the University. 

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities. 

Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs 

Your division's broader role 

The South Australian Tertiary Admissions Centre (SATAC) Limited provides reliable, efficient and innovative tertiary admissions services to its member institutions and on a fee for service basis to other tertiary education institutions in South Australia and the Northern Territory.  

SATAC manages centralised application and admissions processes on behalf of its members and participating fee for service institutions, as well as administering admissions aptitude tests, providing publication and research services, and acting as a one-stop shop for queries regarding application processes and outcomes. 

Learn more at: www.satac.edu.au 

If you have the talent, we'll give you the opportunity. Together, let's make history.

Click on the link below to view the position description and to apply for this opportunity: 

https://careers.adelaide.edu.au/cw/en/job/506183/business-analyst

Please ensure you submit a cover letter, resume, and upload a document that includes your responses to all of the selection criteria for the position as contained in the position description or selection criteria document. 

Applications close 11:55pm, 19 October 2021. 

For further information 

For a confidential discussion regarding this position, contact: 

Michelle Nash 
Manager, Change Delivery Hub

54098788.title: Business Intelligence Specialist
54098788.teaser: Manage, and deploy data systems, reports, and dynamic dashboards, as well as train users in these systems and the use of reports.
54098788.jobAdDetails:
About our team
GFG Alliance is a collection of global businesses and investments owned by Sanjeev Gupta and his family.  The Alliance has 3 core industry groups; Liberty Steel, Alvance Aluminium and SIMEC Energy, different businesses working together as one towards the delivery of a common industrial strategy. We are on a mission to invigorate metals manufacturing and engineering around the world by using sustainable solutions, new technology, local resources, and big thinking.

As members of the GFG Alliance group in Australia, SIMEC Mining and SIMEC Energy as well as Liberty Primary Steel and Liberty Bell Bay, work together as champions of sustainable industry. We are on a mission to invigorate industry and engineering using sustainable solutions, new technology, local resources and big thinking.

About the role
Reporting to the Shared Service Manager, Mining and Primary Steel, we are currently looking to appoint a Business Intelligence Specialist to design, manage, and deploy data systems, reports, and dynamic dashboards, as well as train users in these systems and the use of reports. The Business Intelligence Analyst is also responsible for extracting data from multiple sources, manipulating and validating data, and conducting root cause analysis as well as present analytic findings.

Your responsibilities will include

  • Development of data methodologies, analytics and insights to drive decision making
  • Executing and reviewing data transformation and analytics work performed in the course of business engagements to ensure data quality, integrity and availability is maintained and it provides single source of truth
  • Lead the management of SAP Busines Objects and Microsoft BI
  • Perform detailed analysis of complex business process requirements and provide appropriate system solutions; identify, interpret, validate and document customer requirements
  • Facilitate workshops to collect business requirements
  • Map client business requirements, processes and objectives; develops necessary product modifications to satisfy clients' needs
  • Document functional designs, test cases and results of BI systems
  • Act as liaison with client for troubleshooting: investigate, analyse, and solve software problems
  • Engage wider business stakeholders to identify business intelligence and analysis needs to support the decision making within the relevant functional domains
  • Define business problems and analytical requirements

About your experience
You will be someone who has strong analytical and complex problem-solving skills who enjoys working in a fast paced, flexible environment.  You are also resourceful and have strong communications skills to be able to work effectively in a cross functional team at all levels of the organisation.

Skills and qualifications required:

  • Experience in SAP
  • University degree in Engineering or related discipline
  • Excellent proficiency of MS Power BI or similar BI tools
  • Proven skills with information systems, dashboards, reporting and monitoring performance
  • Experience in Business process mapping (BPM) and Business process re-engineering (BPR).
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Exposure to mining and manufacturing business and operational processes.
  • High-energy and focus on urgent delivery
  • Ability to break down problems into components

Next steps
Across our different business units, we offer career opportunities for people who share our drive, passion and ambition. From apprentices and graduates to experienced professionals, we are committed to offering fulfilling careers and the chance to grow as our business grows. We would love you to be part of our journey.

Apply today.

54099149.title: Energy Analyst
54099149.teaser: A fantastic role to combine your multivariate analysis skills and consulting ability to grow your career in the energy and tech industry
54099149.jobAdDetails:
EGM is excited to be recruiting this Senior Analyst role for a global organisation that partners with some of the biggest companies across the world. They are driven by technology, algorithms and staying ahead of the curve enabling their customers to accurately predict what will happen in energy markets.

As a result of continuous growth, we now have a requirement for an Analyst to join the team based in Adelaide, South Australia. 

Key Duties:

  • Interacting with customers, providing technical support, onsite training and consulting.
  • Tracking support cases from start to finish.
  • Preparing and maintaining system user documentation, help and training materials.
  • Assisting in building, calibrating and maintaining accurate simulation ready data sets for specific markets.
  • Assisting in implementation, comprehension and delivery of power market models and data sets.
  • Researching and performing studies, write reports and papers to demonstrate use of the system for market modelling and analysis.

About You:

You might be a recent graduate with expertise in multivariate analysis and a keen interest in the energy and resources industry or an existing analyst/economist/consultant.

 

Key Duties:

  • Highly consultative, analytical with a keen interest in the energy and resources sectors.
  • A tertiary degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Energy Economics or Operations Research (or similar mathematical science degree).  
  • Working experience and/or knowledge of the Energy Sector with firm understanding of energy economics and market fundamentals.
  • Previous experience and/or knowledge with simulation software and/or tools, Australian NEM.

You will be a self-starter, highly organised, goal driven, take challenges as opportunities to perform and add value.  You will have exceptional attention to detail, which will ensure that you continuously delivery high quality work, meeting the expectations of both your internal and external customers.  You will enjoy problem solving, taking the initiative and improving processes.  You will work unsupervised, but as a member of a much larger team.

 

This is a great opportunity to use your skills and experiences and be part of the next phase of our client's growth.

 

For more information and a confidential chat please contact Mark Johnson or Amber-Rose Sharley at EGM.

54101932.teaser: Do you have experience in Power BI and DAX and are interested in joining a team of data professionals, striving to build industry leading solutions?
roleRequirements: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
54101932.jobAdDetails:
ABOUT US

Journey Beyond is a national business focused on bringing Australia’s unique and iconic experiences to life. Australian-owned, Journey Beyond has a growing national footprint, and is fast positioning itself as one of the largest experiential tourism businesses in the country.

Our aim is to take our guest beyond, to ignite their imagination and to transform amazing into breath taking.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Reporting to the General Manager – Data and Analytics, this role will be responsible for developing a suite of new reports in Power BI for senior and executive leaders within our business. Experience with Power BI and DAX will be critical to your success and you will play a key role in making sure our data is in the hands of the right users.

On top of this core focus, you will also be involved in data warehouse design and development, integration to reservation systems and other business intelligence tasks which support our ‘business as usual’ processes.

ABOUT YOU

  • Extensive experience in a data focused role, university qualifications or similar. Consulting experience is advantageous.
  • Proficient with SQL and the Microsoft business intelligence stack (SSMS, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS).
  • Advanced T-SQL capabilities including procedures, views, functions, constraints.
  • Experience in Power BI, tabular data modelling and DAX.
  • Experience with performance optimisation and execution plans.
  • Willing and eager to drive collaboration within the team and wider business.
  • Able to work autonomously and use initiative to prioritise multiple tasks.
  • Always looking for ways to do things better.
  • Analytical mindset, able to dig through mountains of data to find pearls of wisdom.

If you have the following skills, that would be an added bonus:

  • Microsoft Certifications (MCSA/MCSE equivalent or similar) in data analytics, database development and reporting.
  • Experience with Azure virtual machines and SQL databases. Azure DevOps including build and release pipelines and task boards.

BENEFITS

This is an amazing opportunity to work in a dynamic, growing tourism business where you will have the opportunity to learn from experienced developers and be an integral part in the success of large scale, strategic technology transformation projects.

You will join a team of data professionals, striving to build industry leading solutions. We will leverage your skills and expertise to deliver outstanding solutions.

We will only be considering applicants who are currently residing and have current legal working rights in Australia.

54110619.jobAdDetails:
Experienced Data Scientist: Advanced Analytics & Operations Research Consultancy

Lynxx is a super-fun (we do say so ourselves), creative, flexible, and ambitious advanced analytics, operations research & visualisation consultancy. We have roots in the public transport & logistics sector but with growing practices in social sciences and financial services. We have an office in Sydney to complete work across the globe in conjunction with our European office and we are currently looking for team members to head up our new Adelaide office and in particular we need an experienced Data Scientist to join our consultancy team.  You will need work rights for Australia - we can't sponsor you. 

 

Covid has changed the way that we work, so we're very open for flexible employment and location options, including: 

  • Work from the Adelaide office ("Covid schmovid"), or
  • Hybrid (a bit of both, e.g. office Tues, Weds and Thurs)

It is important to note that an integral part of this role will be to have regular interaction and in-person collaboration with our clients in Adelaide which will include a lot of time working within their offices and/or at other agreed co-locations, so even with flexible working, you'll need to work with our clients a lot. 

In addition there will be quarterly visits to our Sydney offices for company-wide collaborations and catch ups and an annual conference (last time we went to Europe skiing). 

 

You will: 

  • Have at least an honours degree in a specialist quantitative field (econometrics, statistics, actuarial science, mathematics, or physics).
  • Eat numbers for breakfast but also be a creative all-rounder.
  • See the potential in people and tasks and can turn that into new work with our clients.
  • Have a great attitude towards getting work done but, will enjoy working in a fun and dynamic environment.
  • Have a talent for languages, especially programming ones (you will be able to use R and/or Python).
  • Have a passion for communicating with data visually – helping insights come to life with beautiful and meaningful visualisations.
  • Be able to roll up your sleeves (and you will need to make your own coffee and manage your own calendar, but we are sure you will know an app for that).
  • Have an open mind to new methodologies and ways to solve problems, but be able to build a bridge between practice and theory. We try not to confuse confidence with competence, so do not get scared off by our big ambitions.
  • Be tenacious, persistent, and resilient (our copy writer wanted to say ‘attack analytical problems like a dog with a bone’ but we are too nice to actually attack anything).
  • Be comfortable giving and getting feedback.
  • Thrive in diversity (of people, styles & thinking).
  • We tend to use the AWS tech stack, so experience with these tools would be an advantage.

 

We offer:

  • A unique inspiring environment with career opportunities, in a dynamic, flexible team, with a competitive salary.
  • The opportunity to be part of a virtual team: you will work closely with our Dutch team but bringing a local flavour to the work.
  • An environment where learning is mandatory and failing (occasionally) is expected.
  • The chance to shape the development our Asia Pacific business and experience a steep learning curve associated with a scale-up.
  • Fun and challenging work that will help solve the problems that society is facing today and into the future (with a real focus on smart infrastructure and cities).
  • International work experience options with the very best colleagues.
  • An annual company conference (previous trips have included skiing in Austria and next is a Queenstown adventure if lockdown ever ends!).
  • Opportunities to undertake further specialist study at the world's top universities (but we would welcome your feedback on university ranking algorithms).
  • Progression plan and excellent development opportunities – the future is what you make it and we will support your growth.
  • Exposure to cutting edge analytics techniques including machine learning, and what everyone else calls AI (we call it business as usual).
  • Mentoring program over the first 18 months to help you settle into what it means to be part of Lynxx.

 

We want you to thrive, so you must be yourself at 'work'. Our only real rule is to 'do the right thing.' The process of adding people to our team will involve some coffee (other beverages are available), some chats, some practical challenges (data, not DIY) and a period of time for us all to decide whether we can work together. We do not have layers of bureaucracy, so we will be moving quickly in the recruitment process (but still keeping our high standards). 

Occasionally we give each other job titles so we can fill in boxes on tenders (so you will probably want to call yourself a ‘Senior Data Scientist’ on LinkedIn). 

We love diversity of thinking and diverse workplaces (as a small example, we have over 5 first languages in the team, 6 if you include Kiwi) so would especially welcome applications from those who bring something different or unique in their ways of thinking. 

 

The first step of the application, and please pay attention to this as the ability to read the advertisement to the end is the first test, is to send us your CV and a couple of paragraphs (in the cover letter section of this site) about an analytics project that you've been involved in (work or study is fine).  We want to know what excited you about the project and the problems that it could solve. To prove that you have the necessary attention to detail, please include the phrase 'Urban Engine' in your application somewhere. 

 

Good luck!

54111544.jobAdDetails:
Be a part of the team to make South Australia's public education world-class by 2028. The Department for Education is committed to developing an education system where all children and young people reach their potential, enabled by world-class digital technology and systems.

Reporting to the Salesforce Capability Lead, the Business Analyst will contribute to the development and delivery of multiple department related user experience journey reforms, which will inform key critical strategic decisions for the provision of future services to corporate, school and preschool sites and staff across the state.

  • Ability to understand and translate requirements relating to application configuration, development and reporting tools

The Business Analyst will need to be a self-motivated individual with a proven ability to work independently as well as collaboratively.
