54119024.title: Technical Analyst - System Development & Integration
54119024.teaser: Based in Para Hills West. Develop systems, efficient reporting and provide high value data quality services, support and reports.
54119024.jobAdDetails:
About the company

Liebherr’s decades of experience, knowledge, and dedication to the highest quality and most reliable technologies makes us a respected leader and a trustworthy partner to industry. We sell and service earthmoving machinery, mining equipment, mobile cranes, tower cranes, maritime cranes as well as foundation and piling equipment throughout Australia and New Zealand. Are you ready to join the team?

About the role

Reporting to the National IT Manager, you will join the System Development and Integration team where you will be responsible for the provision of system development, efficient SSRS reporting, Business Intelligence reporting, assist in Sharepoint document and services provision, developing systems to integrate and bridge with various systems including payroll, ERP, learning management and other systems as required to provide high value data quality services, support and reports  to the business.

Duties

  • SSRS and Power BI Reporting for Enterprise data
  • Analyse and augment data model, structure and fields
  • Data output, interpretation and Business Intelligence reports
  • Development of systems and tools to support and integrate with business systems
  • Support integrated corporate systems rollout and process changes
  • Provide strong systems and functional support to stakeholders

Skills & experience

  • Degree in Information Technology (IT) or equivalent
  • Microsoft Certifications -MS SQL Server, DBA
  • Working knowledge of Logistics system(s)
  • Specialised software - Nintex, Share gate, Visio professional, j-query hmtl/CSS, JavaScript, SharePoint designer, InfoPath, Photoshop, illustrator, SharePoint Designer

Diversity and Inclusion

Diversity and inclusion sits at the heart of the Liebherr Group’s Core Values.  We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the communities in which we live, work and operate.  Our culture thrives on mutual respect, teamwork and diversity of thought in the workplace.

Culture

We are dedicated to seeing our employees work together in an environment that fosters the true meaning of collaboration; a culture that creates the highest quality, cutting-edge products, long-lasting relationships, and improved organisational and individual capabilities. We aim to give our employees an opportunity to grow and develop their careers. 

Benefits

  • Corporate Health Insurance | Novated Lease | Travel Club
  • Liebherr One Hub – Employee discount portal for great savings
  • Financial stability | annual reviews | service & manager rewards | career progression
  • Join a dynamic and safety focused team
  • Soft skills and Leadership training programs

How to apply

Please apply via the link below. 

Tanya Madden
Senior HR Advisor

Candidates are advised that interviews may commence before closing date. Liebherr Australia would like to thank you for submitting your application.

No agencies or third parties please.

54120381.title: Performance Insights Analyst
54120381.teaser: At AIB, we love data.  If  you are passionate about data, ready to make a difference with how students engage with online education, then apply today!
roleRequirements: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
When are you available to start?
What are your salary expectations?
54120381.jobAdDetails:
• Suitable for a junior data analyst, or a graduate with some level of practical experience
  • Join a closely linked, cross functional team to deliver high value work to a variety of stakeholders
  • You will be given the freedom and support to utilise your developing technical ability to bring the business forward

 

About AIB

AIB delivers life-changing experiences by making higher education affordable and achievable for more people, by removing traditional barriers to entry and providing flexible online learning that is innovative and relevant to today’s business world.

With a global network of more than 16,000 students and alumni in over 90 countries, we are Australia’s largest MBA provider and a leader in online education.

Academic and operational excellence are at the heart of what we do. Combining a smart, digitally focused mentality with an unrelenting dedication to student outcomes we are redefining post graduate education.

 

The Team and Role

The Performance Insights team plays a critical role in the production and communication of business performance across sales, marketing and student progression.

As a key member of our Performance Insights team, you will:

  • ‘Keep the lights on’ by taking the reins of the existing reporting suite
  • Be given several small projects to dive into and get dirty – ranging from process automation, to bug fixing, to fully fledged pieces of analysis
  • Work closely with the Manager of Performance Insights to come up with new and novel ways to provide insight into the many facets of the business and its operations
  • Advocate for data literacy across the business through advice and coaching, as well as through creating and maintaining standardised datasets
  • Take ownership of some of the many questions that come flying your way and provide sharp analytical responses in a timely manner

 

About You

  • Less than 3 years in a data focused role or business analyst role, would also suit recent graduates from analytical disciplines.
  • Scripting/coding experience in R (or Python/VBA)
  • Curiosity for data and analytics technologies and a drive to continuously develop new skills
  • Focused problem solver with an ability to roll up the sleeves without hesitation and persevere through ambiguous and complex challenges
  • Can tell meaningful stories with data – not just produce it
  • Strategic thinker: thinks about tomorrow, believes in the power of data to drive decision-making and generate valuable business insight
  • A driving personality geared towards action, collaboration and disambiguation
  • Customer-centric approach, strikes the right balance between attention to detail and timely execution, able to balance multiple competing priorities
  • Self-directed, self-motivated and self-sufficient, able to make progress with limited oversight
  • Confident communicator, able to easily manage stakeholder expectations, communicate results with clarity and build relationships

AIB provides a flexible work environment, support in fulfilling your career aspirations and the opportunity to leave your mark. You will join a team culture which values performance, continuous learning, memes of both high and low quality, and a desire to squeeze that extra 1% out of our marketing campaigns.

Bonus Coins for:

  • Demonstrated experience using R
  • Ability to apply statistical methods in a practical manner
  • Experience producing automated reports via Markdown, PowerBI or similar

 

To Apply

If this role sounds like you, please submit your resume and cover letter addressing your suitability for the role to Kerri Miller, Senior HR Consultant, by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.   

Applications close: Thursday 7 October 202

54131807.title: Application Analyst
54131807.teaser: As Application Analyst you will be responsible for technical and functional software product support for critical systems BAE.
54131807.jobAdDetails:
APPLICATION ANALYST

 

Apply your talent where it counts as an Application Analyst in our team in our Hosted & Collaboration Systems located on Flinders Street, Adelaide.

 

Despite COVID-19, we have a strong pipeline of job opportunities and we are still hiring. We're continuing to provide the Australian Defence Force with what they need to help protect the nation. We're finding new ways of working in response to COVID-19 and our workforce is still delivering the best capability for Australia. 

 

About the Opportunity

Application Analysts' are responsible for technical and functional software product support, maintenance and development that are managed to provide a cost effective solution to the business or customer.

 

More specifically, you will:

  • Assist with stakeholder management, user support, analysis, development, testing and production delivery coordination.
  • Contribute to timely responses and recommendations on support requests and continuous improvement strategies to customer problems and queries.
  • Contribute to identifying and resolving application malfunctions.
  • Develop and contribute to the definition of general specifications and support documentation.
  • Assist in adapting and configuring application software packages.
  • Create/assemble modules (application objects and components).
  • Assist in the design and configure test cases for integration and unit tests, perform unit tests.
  • Perform and validate solution prototyping.
  • Participate in the monitoring performance against quality assurance plans, SLAs and service continuity.
  • Administer reusable software components and update the nomenclature. Develop knowledge of developing technologies and their application.

 

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Experience in a software engineering environment with suitable tertiary qualifications in IT or similar
  • Exceptional communication skills along with a positive attitude.
  • Experience supporting SharePoint including environments and farms would be nice to have
  • Whilst not essential, experience in PowerShell, C#, .NET or ASP.net is desirable.
  • Whilst not essential, experience with SQL is highly desirable (Oracle PL/SQL or Microsoft T-SQL)
  • Defence security clearance or eligibility to obtain

 

About us

BAE Systems' advanced defence technology solutions protect people and national security, keeping critical information and infrastructure secure.  For more than 65 years we have searched for new ways to provide our customers in Australia with a competitive edge across air, land, sea, cyber, space and electronic domains. 

In terms of our culture, it's safety focused and inclusive.  For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our more than 4,100 employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. It also means providing a safe, family friendly, flexible and supportive place to work.  Join us.

 

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance. 

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Calvin Ebenezer Talent Acquisition Specialist - IM&T and made online here.

Whilst applications must be made online, confidential enquiries are very welcome via email: calvin.ebenezer@baesystems.com

We welcome and strongly encourage applications from women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and Veterans for these opportunities.  An inclusive culture and an exciting, supportive career opportunity awaits.  We are also proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for Women. If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://tinyurl.com/Work180BAE-Systems-Australia

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

BAE Systems Australia will never request money from you during the recruitment process. Please be aware of scam messages asking for money for an administration fee, visa or similar. If you receive such a message please report it to Scam Watch www.scamwatch.gov.au/report-a-scam.

Job applications should only be submitted via the BAE Systems Australia website and not via email.  If you receive an email from BAE Systems that does not utilise "@baesystems.com" as the domain, it is not legitimate.  BAE Systems does not use gmail, aol, Hotmail or similar accounts.

54141887.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
54141887.teaser: This role is dynamic, challenging and highly rewarding – and best of all we get the see real outcomes every day resulting from what we do.
54141887.jobAdDetails:
hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our product ecosystem of buy now pay later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.

The group has an insatiable appetite for analytics and insight; we understand and leverage data to deliver world-class customer experiences, operational processes, and strategic decisions. Our analysts are rock stars and recognised for the great work they do. 

The Business Intelligence Analyst role is a multi-faceted function. You get to work on strategic projects, provide analytics and consulting to business partners, deliver on ad hoc requests, and work on analytics products. Across these varied engagements your primary responsibility is to enable our organisation to extract the most value possible from our data assets. Your expertise enables you to analyse and model data to extract valuable insights and present this back in a form which enables timely business decisions and actions.

You will be responsible for:

  • Working closely with the Humm group business to understand their business need and requirements for analytics and insight.
  • Discovering and blending data from our data warehouse, source systems and other internal and external data. You need to understand data origin and sources of authority for data and ensure that data is consistent and fit for purpose.
  • Analysing large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns and validate and socialise these discoveries. There are opportunities to learn and leverage advanced analytics approaches such as data science and probability predictions to forecast outcomes and identify hidden customer behaviour.
  • Presenting your analysis to the business community using data visualisation and storytelling techniques ensuring that data elements are clear, well defined, and unambiguous. You will demonstrate understanding of the problem domain, business processes and the underlying systems and data sources.
  • Applying appropriate data governance to your solutions aligning with our data standards and controls.
  • There are opportunities to mentor junior analysts in the team.

About you:

  • Relevant tertiary qualification or analytics experience.
  • An enthusiasm for data analytics and motivated to be the best you can be in this exciting and rapidly changing landscape. You are naturally curious with a strong attention to detail and motivated to go the extra mile to deliver outstanding outcomes. 
  • You have high data literacy and technically capable, but also someone who equally enjoys working in the business and building relationships. You are comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic work environment, are highly consultative, confident to voice your opinion when necessary and pride yourself on being a good listener.
  • Possess strong attention to detail, reconciliation, and testing. Highly organised and reliable.
  • Good time management with the ability to multitask, prioritise and deliver to schedule. Work well under pressure and use judgement in problem solving.
  • Driven to constantly learn, develop new skills, and share these capabilities – importantly you have a growth mindset. 

Skills Required

  • Competent analyst and problem-solver.
  • Able to understand business requirements, translate these requirements into prototypes and analytic solutions, and deliver through visual reports and dashboards.
  • Excellent communication with an ability to interact with different stakeholders, both non-technical and technical.
  • Experience in Microsoft Power BI and Microsoft Office is a requirement. You are confident working with large datasets, building data sets and competent in developing and publishing reports and dashboards.
  • Able to manage multiple work requests concurrently, self-manage your workload and manage expectations with stakeholders. 

About the team

The Data and Analytics team sits within wider IT function. We are a team that is tasked with using data, analytics, AI and automation across the organisation to deliver outstanding outcomes.

We work within a flat organisational structure which encourages strong relationships, ownership, teamwork, and autonomy. 

We have a great team culture, where we celebrate openness, our willingness to support each other, and a strong focus on learning and innovation.

54144787.title: Information Analyst: Data Management
54144787.teaser: Work in a progressive and innovative organisation. Immediate start. 6 month contract role. CBD location.
54144787.jobAdDetails:
• 6 month contract – 2 roles 
  • Immediate start
  • Progressive and innovative organisation

About the role
We are seeking experienced Information/Data Analysts to work in a temporary role in the Higher Education industry. The roles work closely with relevant stakeholders to respond to student data enquiries, and where necessary develop and or update student data reports. Other tasks include responding to incoming access requests for student administration systems.

Skills & experience

To excel in this role, you will have experience in enterprise reporting software (COGNOS, Power BI, data warehouses and packages). You will also have experience in using SQL to extract relevant data. 

Culture & benefits

An opportunity to work for a renowned and prestigious educational institution during an exciting time of change and development. Full time hours in a central location. Our team at Entree takes great pride in looking after and supporting our candidates on their journey to find their ideal assignment. Communication with our candidates, clients and within the team is key to our continued success in SA.

Applications in Microsoft Word only should be addressed to Ruth Haren quoting reference number JO-2109-5328. Telephone enquiries are welcome on 8100 8875. To apply, please click the ‘Apply’ button.

54150559.title: Data Analyst
54150559.teaser: We are seeking a Data Analyst to work alongside a team to help identify clients’ business needs, gather user requirements, and develop user stories.
54150559.jobAdDetails:
• Full-time (76 Fortnightly Hours) or part time, 2-year Fixed Term Contract with possibility of renewal
  • Competitive Annual Salary + Super + Salary Packaging 
  • Located in Adelaide

Relationships Australia South Australia (RASA) is a dynamic community services organisation that delivers a broad range of programs and services. As a not-for-profit organisation, RASA’s purpose is to strengthen individual and family safety and build protective factors, which enable people to have healthy relationships, improved wellbeing, and improved social cohesion. Their belief in the transformative power of relationships lies at the heart of everything they do.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Information Technology & Data Management team.

The Data Analyst work alongside a team to help identify clients’ business needs, gather user requirements, and develop user stories. Data Analyst is to assist with the implementation, optimisation, and support of RASA’s data analytics.

Key responsibilities for this role will include:
• Delivery of scheduled reports within required timelines as determined by RASA federal and state funders
• Design and maintain management reports.
• Liaise with RASA service leaders to ascertain their requirements - such as reporting, configuration or technical efficiencies, as directed to the General Manager, Information and Management.

To be successful in this role you must have a bachelor degree (AQF Level 7) in information technology, data science or similar course or IIBA certification.

You will be a team player who possesses a confident and engaging personality and thrives in a fast-paced troubleshooting role to provide exceptional customer service.

Additionally, the following is highly valued:
• Experience in, or knowledge of data visualisation software, data science and or business intelligence.
• Experience with data integration design practices including Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) and ELT.
• Experience with Tableau, with regards to defining measurable outcomes, building, and formatting visualizations.
• Relational database experience, including the use of Forms, Queries, Functions, Stored Procedures, etc.

A working with Children Check is essential and employment is not able to commence without a current clearance.

For more details, please see Position Description

Enquiries: Any enquiries can be addressed to Joanna Retnam on 08 8216 5200.

Closing Date: 9:00am, Monday 11th October 2021

Relationships Australia South Australia is a Child Safe and Equal Opportunity Employer.

54153618.title: Data Analyst
54153618.teaser: Are you passionate about data? The ability to look beneath the numbers, and have a penchant for creating and tracking meaningful KPIs is what we need!
roleRequirements: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
How many years' experience do you have as a data analyst?
Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of business intelligence (BI) best practices?
54153618.jobAdDetails:
Data Analyst

Stoller Australia

 

Stoller employs over 1000 employees and distributes to more than 50 countries worldwide. Stoller Australia has representatives and distributors throughout the country and a production base in South Australia. Stoller employ skilled representatives who work nationwide with growers, consultants, agronomists and distributors to assist growers in maximising yield potential.

 

The Data Analyst is a newly created role designed as a critical support to management through a period of unprecedented growth.  Whilst this is fundamentally a finance role, the Data Analyst must love and be highly proficient operating in a project-based environment with an extensive successful background in continuous/process improvement. This role is intended to be the key conduit between management and successful results, through the conversion of the strategic plan to effective operational plans in conjunction with key stakeholders.

To be successful in this role you must be commercially minded, self-motivated, and a results-driven team player who has a passion for hands-on work. You will have previous experience in managing by numbers with a penchant for creating and tracking meaningful KPIs. Your strong communication skills will ensure our workforce understands our trajectory and how their efforts contribute to results.

Key Responsibilities

With dual reporting to the Finance and Administration Manager and the General Manager, the role focusses on organisation-wide project management where the key outcome is growth and sustainability, this includes but is not limited to the following:

  • collating and interpreting data to inform budget forecasts ensuring that future plans are provided for
  • translating strategic objectives to operational plans, and improvement projects where necessary
  • analysing, reporting, providing financial insights and driving outcomes for various business initiatives
  • setting, monitoring and reporting on organisational and project KPIs
  • internal and external stakeholder management with a focus on growth and improvement.

Skills, Knowledge & Experience

The ability to look beneath the numbers, along with effective interpersonal skills, excellent collaboration, and a can-do attitude will be critical to your success in this role. A positive outlook and a genuine desire to make a difference is a must.

Together with the above requirements you will have the ability to multi-task, be able to demonstrate initiative and have the ability to problem solve and be a quick thinker under pressure. 

Other key success factors are:

  • minimum 3 years’ experience
  • Tertiary qualifications in Accounting / Finance / Business Administration
  • exceptional analytical and reporting skills
  • highly developed organisational skills and demonstrated ability to set priorities and meet deadlines
  • a high level of proficiency in Microsoft Suite with advanced Excel skills (power BI desirable)
  • strong and confident communication skills with all stakeholders (written and verbal) with an ability to appropriately influence and negotiate.

What else is on offer?

Stoller Australia provides a rewarding, positive and challenging workplace for our employees. An attractive salary package will be negotiated with the successful candidate.

Applications close 5pm Monday, 11 October 2021.

Apply now or for a confidential discussion, please contact the Stoller HR Department on (08) 8169 0900.

54158395.title: Performance and Data Specialist
54158395.teaser: You will be a Data Specialist that will have the opportunity to get out into the field and discover our regional locations.
54158395.jobAdDetails:
Interesting opportunity to work as a Performance and Data Specialist within our Finance team. This role is not like other Data Specialist roles where you will be grounded to your seat. You will have the opportunity to go out in the field and mingle with our regional managers and district leaders and add value to these groups by providing expert advice as to how data and reporting can add value to their team.

You need to be good at explaining technical jargon to non-technical people as you spend time in the field, learning the heart and back bone of SA Water.

As a Performance and Data Specialist you will deliver timely and accurate data and performance reporting to inform key stakeholders and ensure customer expectations and regulatory requirements are met.

Your responsibilities for this opportunity include:

Contribute effectively to the team ensuring efforts are aligned toward achieving team goals.

  • Seek and collate business performance drivers from key stakeholders at Lendlease and SA Water.
  • Establish a performance reporting framework for Field Services.
  • Produce timely reports on regulatory and KPI performance including detailed commentary and appropriate recommendations.
  • Monitor business performance and communicate emerging trends, e.g., risks, improvements, back to the business in a timely manner.
  • Support the development of business performance KPIs and setting business priorities and goals.
  • Review and audit the reports and analysis produced by Lendlease’ analysts to ensure they are accurate. 
  • Work closely with the Operations leadership team to ensure current performance is clear and where required can contribute to the development of appropriate action plans.
  • Deliver all data and information related initiatives in a way that aligns to and supports enterprise data standards.

Your success in this role will come from:

  • Tertiary qualification in IT, Business or Computer Science or equivalent experience.
  • Demonstrated experience in data analyst/modelling in a large commercial environment with demonstrated advanced problem solving, analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
  • Advanced Power BI, MS Excel and MS Access skills, (Power Query, Power Pivot Skills).
  • Advanced SQL Skills. Proficient in technologies including Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, Azure Machine Learning Studio, and Big Data technologies.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills including an ability to collaborate to deliver an improved customer experience.

Our business and people are passionate about what we do and getting out there and learning about your stakeholders will give you the opportunity to truly make a difference.

Further information can be found in the attached PD.  PD_Performance and Data Specialist.pdf

To apply, click ‘apply’ and submit your cover letter and resume. Applications close 5.00pm Monday, 4 October 2021.

Further queries can be directed to Enrica Papa - Enrica.Papa@sawater.com.au

Your wellbeing

At SA Water the health and wellbeing of our people is important to us. Our people are encouraged to have a healthy work/life balance, look after themselves and focus on their personal health and wellbeing goals. Visit our website and learn what it’s like to Work with us. https://www.sawater.com.au/about-us/careers/work-with-us

We believe great outcomes for our customers are best delivered by a diverse and inclusive team that reflects our community. That's why we encourage people seeking flexible working arrangements and from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, to apply and join our team.

54158399.title: Performance and Data Specialist
54158399.teaser: You will be a Data Specialist that will have the opportunity to get out into the field and discover our regional locations.
54158399.jobAdDetails:
Interesting opportunity to work as a Performance and Data Specialist within our Finance team. This role is not like other Data Specialist roles where you will be grounded to your seat. You will have the opportunity to go out in the field and mingle with our regional managers and district leaders and add value to these groups by providing expert advice as to how data and reporting can add value to their team.

You need to be good at explaining technical jargon to non-technical people as you spend time in the field, learning the heart and back bone of SA Water.

As a Performance and Data Specialist you will deliver timely and accurate data and performance reporting to inform key stakeholders and ensure customer expectations and regulatory requirements are met.

Your responsibilities for this opportunity include:

Contribute effectively to the team ensuring efforts are aligned toward achieving team goals.

  • Seek and collate business performance drivers from key stakeholders at Lendlease and SA Water.
  • Establish a performance reporting framework for Field Services.
  • Produce timely reports on regulatory and KPI performance including detailed commentary and appropriate recommendations.
  • Monitor business performance and communicate emerging trends, e.g., risks, improvements, back to the business in a timely manner.
  • Support the development of business performance KPIs and setting business priorities and goals.
  • Review and audit the reports and analysis produced by Lendlease’ analysts to ensure they are accurate. 
  • Work closely with the Operations leadership team to ensure current performance is clear and where required can contribute to the development of appropriate action plans.
  • Deliver all data and information related initiatives in a way that aligns to and supports enterprise data standards.

Your success in this role will come from:

  • Tertiary qualification in IT, Business or Computer Science or equivalent experience.
  • Demonstrated experience in data analyst/modelling in a large commercial environment with demonstrated advanced problem solving, analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
  • Advanced Power BI, MS Excel and MS Access skills, (Power Query, Power Pivot Skills).
  • Advanced SQL Skills. Proficient in technologies including Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, Azure Machine Learning Studio, and Big Data technologies.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills including an ability to collaborate to deliver an improved customer experience.

Our business and people are passionate about what we do and getting out there and learning about your stakeholders will give you the opportunity to truly make a difference.

Further information can be found in the attached PD.  PD_Performance and Data Specialist.pdf

To apply, click ‘apply’ and submit your cover letter and resume. Applications close 5.00pm Monday, 4 October 2021.

Further queries can be directed to Enrica Papa - Enrica.Papa@sawater.com.au

Your wellbeing

At SA Water the health and wellbeing of our people is important to us. Our people are encouraged to have a healthy work/life balance, look after themselves and focus on their personal health and wellbeing goals. Visit our website and learn what it’s like to Work with us. https://www.sawater.com.au/about-us/careers/work-with-us

We believe great outcomes for our customers are best delivered by a diverse and inclusive team that reflects our community. That's why we encourage people seeking flexible working arrangements and from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, to apply and join our team.

54159390.title: Data Integration Analyst / Lead
54159390.teaser: Design, planning, implementation & maintenance of end to end integration solutions to support data management, data analysis & reporting processes.
54159390.jobAdDetails:
The Data Integration Lead and Data Integration Analyst are responsible for providing technical expertise and leadership in the development and delivery of effective data integration solutions in line with the Department for Education’s strategic goals and objectives. The positions will work closely with data and reporting analysts, ICT professionals and business intelligence analysts to lead and manage the design, planning, implementation and maintenance of end to end integration solutions to support effective data management, data analysis and reporting processes.

The successful applicant is required to gain a Department for Human Services (DHS) working with children check (WWCC) prior to being employed which is required to be renewed every five years before expiry.

The incumbent will be required to undertake RRHAN –EC (Responding to Risks of Harm, Abuse and Neglect - Education Care) Facilitator Lead (Masterclass) extended course or the online (Fundamentals) course which will be required to be updated every three years. 

For all other Special Conditions please refer to the Role Description.

Enquiries to Karina Strudwick Email: karina.strudwick@sa.gov.au

For further information and details on how to apply for this vacancy, please go to iworkfor.sa.gov.au and search for vacancy numbers 457073 and 457086.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

Closing date is 5pm, 14 October 2021

54169416.title: Staff Data Scientist (leadership position)
54169416.teaser: Join a Global Tech Company and help build their Centre of Excellence in Australia!
54169416.jobAdDetails:
This is a rare and exciting opportunity for a Sr. Data Scientists with leadership expereince to join a Global Tech Company to help build their Australian Centre of Excellence and be part of a global team of over 40 Data Scientists. The company is Adelaide based, but they are open to receiving applications from top talent all over Australia.

Educational Qualifications:

Bachelors, Master's or PhD degree from reputed universities or institutes in one of the following disciplines:

  • Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning
  • Cognitive Computing
  • Computational Linguistics
  • Computer Science
  • Data Science

Requirements

  • 7+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning
  • 7+ years of experience with general purpose programming languages e.g., Python, C/C++, Java
  • Key requirement: 2+ years of hands-on experience in resource optimization and reinforcement learning techniques such as Thompson Sampling, Upper Confidence Bound algorithms, and other solution approaches to the MAB class of problems
  • Key requirement: Strong understanding and exposure to the Multi-Armed Bandit (MAB) problem and its variants (e.g., contextual MAB, dueling MAB, adversarial MAB, combinatorial MAB, etc.)
  • Strong understanding of problems in the ad optimization and personalization space
  • Exposure to machine learning platforms such as TensorFlow, TensorFlow Extended, PyTorch
  • Good to have experience building and deploying machine learning models on the Cloud (Google Cloud, Azure, AWS)
  • Good to have experience with production architecture of machine learning systems
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate cross-functionally
  • Good presentation skills
  • Attention to detail

Responsibilities

  • Implement machine learning models into the products and offerings through collaborate with the Engineering and Product teams.
  • Lead a small team of data scientists. Be responsible for implementing the machine learning models, testing them, refining them, and taking them to production for our ad optimization and personalization product/offering.
  • Collaborate with other teams in the Data Science Group to review and refine your work to ensure the highest quality
  • Collaborate with the product owners and the data science leadership to chart the AI vision for ad optimization and personalization.

54171040.title: Systems Analyst
54171040.teaser: The System Analyst is responsible for the design and configuration of new functional solutions.
54171040.jobAdDetails:
• Brisbane and Adelaide location
  • Must be an Australian Citizen
  • Initially until 30th October 2022 with 24 months extension
About the roles:

The System Analyst is responsible for the design and configuration of new
functional solutions, and for the ongoing operational support of ICT solutions. They are
also responsible for designing and optimising enterprise-wide deployment of ICT
technology solutions. Senior System Analysts require an understanding of ICT product
offerings and their interoperability with other components as well as a high level
understanding of interface technology. The System Analyst works under the limited
direction of senior staff. They exercise both initiative and judgement in the interpretation
of policy, and in the application of practices and procedures. Decision making is
dependent on judgement, skills and knowledge. The System Analyst manages and
organises their own work in the context of competing priorities, including contributing to
business planning, changes in workplace practices and business improvement
strategies. The System Analyst may manage a team
 
Required experience
 
  • Demonstrated experience working in both multi-disciplinary agile and waterfall team environments
  • Demonstrate experience as a lead System Analyst on a high profile and complex IT project
  • Developing and documenting system specifications and modelling in consultation with technical experts e.g. UML and BPMN
  • Assisting the Team developing computer systems and undertaking specialist activities and provide associated advice.
  • Experience working with SAP CRM or ABAP would be highly desirable
 
 
For further information please call Thelma Ban on 02 6113 7547 or email on thelma.ban@ignite co.com

54171607.title: Principal Data Scientist (2 positions available)
54171607.teaser: This is an exciting opportunity for 2 Principal Data Scientists to join a Global Tech Company to help build their Australian Centre of Excellence!
54171607.jobAdDetails:
This is a rare and exciting opportunity for 2 Principal Data Scientists to join a Global Tech Company to help build their Australian Centre of Excellence and be part of a global team of almost 1.000 IT professionals (40 Data Scientists). The company is Adelaide based, but they are open to receiving applications from top talent all over Australia.

The Platforms team of the Data Science Group builds scalable AI to aid in conversational AI, agent assist solutions, and ad personalization for the Cloud. We are looking for a highly motivated and qualified data scientist to lead some of our AI initiatives. This role is ideal for candidates with strong, hands-on skills in machine learning and natural language processing.

Educational Qualifications:

Bachelors, Master's or PhD degree from reputed universities or institutes in one of the following disciplines:

  • Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning
  • Cognitive Computing
  • Computational Linguistics
  • Computer Science
  • Data Science

Requirements

  • 10+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning
  • 10+ years of experience with general purpose programming languages e.g., Python, C/C++, Java
  • 4+ years of experience leading multiple machine learning projects simultaneously
  • Experience with machine learning platforms such as TensorFlow, TensorFlow Extended, PyTorch
  • Experience building and deploying machine learning models on the Cloud (Google Cloud, Azure, AWS)
  • Experience in solving problems related to Natural Language Processing (NLP), Natural Language Understanding (NLU), and Natural Language Generation (NLG)
  • Extensive experience in various deep learning models, e.g., transformers, LSTMs, RNNs
  • Experience with production architecture of machine learning systems
  • Experience leading and mentoring a team of data scientists
  • Nice to have exposure to conversational AI, AI-based question-answering systems, and AI-based compliance and monitoring systems
  • Nice to have exposure to MLOps pipelines and Kubeflow
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate cross-functionally
  • Good presentation skills
  • Attention to detail

Responsibilities

  • Define and build AI models into the products and offerings by collaborating with the Engineering and Product teams
  • Lead the development of machine learning models and their production architecture
  • Review and refine your work through collaboration within the Data Science Group to
  • Lead and own the AI initiatives end to end for at least 2-3 products
  • Lead and mentor a team of data scientists, and be responsible for their work allocation and tracking
  • Work with the data science leadership and product leadership to define the AI roadmap for the company

54173479.title: Are YOU The Technical Support And Data Management Guru We Need?!
54173479.teaser: Join a rapidly growing family owned business supporting sheep farmers to succeed with Software and Technology.
roleRequirements: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
Do you have customer service experience?
54173479.jobAdDetails:
About the role: 

Due to our continued growth, a full-time position in an industry Leading Software and Technology business is available. Supporting sheep farmers to achieve success with software and technology is what we do. We are looking to appoint a tech savvy, customer focused and driven individual with a passion for farming and helping people succeed.

The Technical Support Guru is an integral part of our team, working with other support staff, our client experience manager, business leaders and other staff to support clients, build systems and improve products. Whilst this position is primarily focussed on technical support and data management there are opportunities to grow elsewhere within our business.


Key Responsibilities (include but not limited to):

  • Answering the phone and working with clients to resolve support related queries about BreedELITE products.
  • Supporting data entry and onboarding of new clients.
  • Learn and understand all BreedELITE Products (including Software, Auto Drafter, Stick Reader, Fleece Weigh and other ancillary devices) and how farmers are trying to use them to achieve their goals
  • Identify product and process improvements and contribute to the development and enhancement of existing business systems and products
  • Provide a friendly point of contact for, and build relationships with our clients
  • Maintain records and information in line with company policies.
  • Have fun.

Skills & Experience: 

  • Experience in a customer facing role preferred but not required (note this could be in any industry)
  • Strong understanding of computers and software for Microsoft and Apple operating systems (this may be through experience generated as a hobby – no formal qualifications needed)
  • Good initiative is imperative, with the ability to think ahead.
  • Desire to learn and grow at a personal level.
  • Effective communication skills are paramount.
  • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Confidentiality
  • Respectful of people and have an ability to meet them where they are at
  • Good organisational skills, attention to detail, and good awareness of surroundings.
  • Record keeping skills with demonstration of a concern for accuracy.
  • The ability to consider, plan, and execute particular operations or projects.
  • High follow through

About the Company:

BreedELITE is a rapidly growing family-owned business based in Adelaide. We support Sheep Farmers all across Australia to get control of their sheep data and succeed with Precision Sheep Management.

Helping sheep farmers turn their sheep data into profit, faster, through simple and integrated software and technology solutions backed by world class support is what we do.

We value innovation through simplicity and lead our team with a growth mindset. As an emerging business we have fun at work but are always serious about our mission and our commitment to helping our clients succeed.

How to apply:

Apply through Seek or email your resume and cover letter to admin@breedelite.com by COB 20th Oct 2021.

Please include the contact details of 2 references with your application.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for a phone screening interview.

We look forward to hearing from you!
